column4: hey guys yesterday I was using the alternate cd to make an install on an encrypted volume, when done it would not accept my password.  Is there a way I can remove this encryption stuff from the drive?  It seems to only show as 7.66gb now rather than 8gb like it used to.  Also whenever i put the disk in linux it complains about not authoriized when i try to mount it or use disk utility on it etc.
i would like to get rid of the encrypted volume so that i can try this installation again
you should be able to delete the partition with GPArted from the Live CD, I suppose
that does not work i tried that.
